feeds.source: The Record from Recorded Future News

items.title: Khashoggi widow files complaint in France alleging Saudi government infected devices with spyware
items.summary: A French judge will determine whether investigators should proceed with a complaint from the widow of slain writer Jamal Khashoggi alleging that Saudi Arabia deployed spyware on her devices before his killing.

items.title: Seoul cyber investigators seize data, devices from ‘South Korea’s Amazon’ following data breach
items.summary: Cyber investigators from the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency seized devices and data from one of the country's largest tech firms to find evidence uncovering how the breach took place.

items.title: Trump plans executive order curbing state AI laws
items.summary: Legislators at both the state and federal level have increasingly scrutinized how AI models suck up data for training purposes.

items.title: More than $2 billion in payments from 4,000 ransomware incidents reported to Treasury in recent years
items.summary: The Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) released a study covering 4,194 ransomware incidents that were reported through the Bank Secrecy Act over the three-year period.

items.title: Meta proposal for less data sharing is approved by European Commission
items.summary: Instagram and Facebook users in the EU will now have the option to share less personal data and see fewer personalized ads.

items.title: Russian kids revolt as Kremlin bans Roblox, other popular apps
items.summary: The ban on Roblox has drawn a sharp backlash from the platform’s roughly 18 million monthly Russian users — mostly children and teenagers — who have launched social-media campaigns and video petitions urging officials to restore access.

items.title: Researchers track dozens of organizations affected by React2Shell compromises tied to China’s MSS
items.summary: Researchers have confirmed more than 30 affected organizations tied to the React2Shell bug that emerged last week.
